comments.commentBody: Great job!  I congratulate you on your clever iambs as well as your quiet, but efficient aplomb.

Jon,
I guess that K.P. and Chase are just glass half-full type of fans. :)

Hurray for the Obama administration!  We need to make our food safer.  We need to go back to smaller farms and more natural raising of animals.  Happier, healthier animals make more nutritious food. It's better for the land, the people, and the animals. And, these mega subsidies to these mega companies makes very few people ultra-rich at the expense of us all.  Spread the wealth for better health!  Our country benefits from more people sharing the profits for their work. Let's stop subsidizing crops as well!

Those who think these Tea Party wins are good news for the Democrats are counting on American voters to suddenly become sane and logical somewhere between now and November 2nd.

I hope they're right, but I'm afraid they're wrong. Very afraid.

The folks in Glen Urquhart ,Scotland, must be mighty proud this evening of their namesake in Delaware.  Really, it's a glen in the Highland, which the UK Forestry commission describes as having "an attractive mix of planted, conifer forest and native, broadleaved woodlands."

My guess for tomorrow's Onion headline:

Paladino Wins Right to Lose to Andrew Cuomo in November
"...all of the outstanding vote in New Hampshire is from the numerous small villages and rural hamlets that dot the state."  Boy, that is just lovely, Nate.

The bottom line is that the extinction of Castle's political career will help Republicans be tougher on President Obama next year.  Knowing that the Tea Party can take out candidates almost anywhere it focuses its attention should be a source of strength for those demanding smaller government and a return to the basics of the U.S. Constitution.  Obviously, a lot of us think that if we need people like Castle to have a majority in the Senate...we don't need a majority in the Senate.  As a political scientist, I don't see anything "emotional" or irrational about that...
Looks like the GOP turnout is dwarfing the Dems in NH and WI and nearly even in deep blue NY.
@Brendon.........Ayotte is narrowing the gap with Lamontagne.

I am a lifelong Republican, a fiscal conservative and was in favor of the Tea Party movement when it began...even attended the September march last year.  Now I see the Tea Party as being disruptive to the unity of the Republican Party.  The only way we Republicans can win is to attract moderates and Independents.  I fear for our country because the Dems are pulling radically to the left and the Republicans are pulling radically to the right.  No compromise in sight.  This is what happens when people do not learn their history lessons.  Our country would not have come into existence were it not for the compromises our Founding Fathers made.  We need more moderates in this country and fewer hardline lefties like Obama and hard line righties like Palin.

some similarities?
no kidding.
gigo.

Bart, revolution means a lot more than leashing a dog. And I'll say it again clearly, the Tea Party is doing nothing revolutionary by running more conservative candidates in the very mainstream Republican party that has a proven record of big, overpowerful, expensive government. Revolution means changing the dominant paradigm, not being part of it. Try again, you fail in your argument and you fail at revolution. If you want to bring real change, you have to bring it outside of the Republican or Democratic party.

I looked at the website.  Within the first minute checking the "most popular" I found an article "Wahabi Imam to burn the Bible" stating:  "Throughout Islam’s long history, Muslims have never been involved in any actions of religious suppression against Jews and Christians."  Oh, yes, and 100% of the population voted for the dear leader!

Snail pace legislation is no match to the high frequency trade.

Crashrapnel depression is bound to come. The optimum market disruption is May 6th type for whoever raked in gazillions, but the greed will careen away beyond the high frequency traders' intention into a world wide sudden-death kind of depression sooner or later. Who gave the Wall Street the key to the Pandora's box? I am afraid the market economy worshippers.

It looks like the conservatives and the tea party people have been underrepresented in the polling tonight, most notably in NY. Lazio had polled ahead by double digits as recently as two weeks ago and only one late poll even showed it being close, yet he loses by 25 points?

Must be because they all have cell phones only.

I'm late in the comment game, and I only got as far as #5 where Will posits "Pure claptrap!" by claiming that based on Darwin, antibiotics are part of his agenda. Either Will is a serious protagonist, or he doesn't understand science, which would suggest survival of the fittest is how we got here. Nothing against antibiotics, but the people that survived the plague without them are why the human race, via Europe is still here.

And now I'll state my point emotionally. Industrial farming is a disgrace! I'm an omnivore and there is no reason animals need to suffer so a Whopper costs $3.75 vs $4.00.
Words cannot express how thoroughly sick and tired I am of reading the name Lady Gaga!!!

Very nice atmosphere, very clean, new and well managed. Nice staff, kind and helpfull.I liked breakfast area which was on the back of the hotel, inside and outside part, on a very small quiet street, more clean than other such streets. Good location.Follow the tram line up and find the gate to Topkapi Palace, go another 30 metres and find very-very good turkish restaurants. Easy to explore area, near Blue Mosque, Hagia Sogia, Grand Bazar. Go to Bazar before 11 o'clock when it's not crouded. Once again a comfortable hotel, good soundproof from outside, AC. Not good soundproof between rooms, but we had no problems with neighbours. And take a Bosphorus cruise at night you can book front desk( with drinks included-50 €/person and belly dancers) . It's great fun.

Room a bit small for 2 large adults.Very slow lift as we were on the 5th floor. We were normal adults and felt ok in the room. Good sized bathroom.I think it is ok even for longer stays.The area is not clean. It is close to station area , and like all station areas has it's problems with different kind of people. Don't walk as a lonely turist female on the streets not even on daytime. And try to go on other months but august. Too hot to walk during day, and very pricy shopping time of year.Very-very noisy poeple on the streets, very crouded. Very good hotel on a so-so area.

I'm pretty sure the Tea Party candidates are going to prevail in November as well. It's going to be positively frightening though when they get to Washington and have no clue how to run a country. Leaving everything up to the people and reducing what you actually do is not a solution. I sense a total disaster, but let's see what happens.

I don't know much about Christine O'Donnell but the Tea Baggers are ruining the Republican Party. Do they have any serious ideas for dealing with the economy, national debt, energy policy, the environment, etc?

I say this not as a partisan Democrat - I'm an Independent/moderate Republican (a "RINO" in the parlance of the true believers in the GOP today). The GOP used to be the party of fiscal discipline, ethical behavior, responsible leadership, intellectual honesty - i.e., the GOP used to stand up against the excesses of the Democratic Party and that party's appeals to class warfare. Today, the GOP goes toe-to-toe with the Democrats in pandering to the public's baser instincts, ignorance and fears.

The party of Eisenhower, Goldwater, Rockefellar, even Nixon - serious thinkers all - is quickly disappearing. Yes, there are some thinkers left in the GOP - Richard Lugar, Judd Gregg, Paul Ryan for example - but these are the exception, not the rule.

Today, I'm not sure what the GOP stands for anymore and I have no confidence in their ability to fix America - our problems can't be solved solely with tax cuts.
Seems pretty clear that decisions are being made in a scientific fashion and not a political one...

I honestly don't care who she is. I don't care if humpy dumpy is running for office. The incumbent is out. That is all that matters to me.#167
-------------------------------------------------------------
What short-sighted, damaging thinking. Here's what you will get:

"How do you propose to put people back to work?"

"Freedom!"

"What is your policy on education?"

"The Constitution!"

"If you repeal health care reform how will poor people get medical care?"

"Freedom! Wait, did I say that already? I mean, the Constitution!"

"How do you propose to balance the budget?"

"The Constitution! And...and...Freedom! Yeah, that's it! Freedom!"

You get what you vote for.

Here's a good article to read that should be forwarded widely. People need to learn about the billionaires and the very largest corporations behind the phony populist tea party.

Covert Operations--The billionaire brothers who are waging a war against Obama.

By Jane Mayer

http://www.newyorker.com...

I would warn the democrats against complacency... They were so certain that a Republican would never win Ted Kennedy's seat in Mass and look what happens
Every one needs to wake up and work vigorously and tirellessly if they don't want the country taken over by racist nuts.
Don't "misunderesdimate" the rage of people who cannot get over the fact that a black is president and a woman speaker... and are quick to forget that TARP was created by Bush and we spent 10 Billions a month on a war of choice...
